reviews.review: I had heart surgery at this hospital, and I couldn't be more grateful for the exceptional care I received. The surgeons were highly skilled and explained everything thoroughly, putting my mind at ease. The nursing staff was attentive, compassionate, and always ready to help. The entire team made my recovery process much smoother. Im deeply thankful for their professionalism and kindness throughout my treatment!

Doctors do unneccesary tests to make the bills high.

bad experience and most doctors looks freshers.

high bills > poor treatment

My father was admitted to this hospital with 40% cardiac function, based on a suggestion from another doctor. The initial plan was to perform an angiogram here and then move him to Narayana Hospital in Bangalore for further treatment.

However, what followed was one of the most distressing experiences we've ever had. Despite him walking and speaking normally upon arrival, he was immediately shifted to the ICU. From that point on, things spiraled downward. His regular medications were changed without proper explanation, and we were kept in the dark about critical decisions.

Student doctors handled his case with minimal supervision, and the senior staff, including the head nurse, were unapproachable and rude. Even the basic courtesy you'd expect from support staff like ICU cleaners was missing.

Most shockingly, without any informed consent from our family, they placed him on an invasive ventilator and conducted X-ray. Within just two days of admission, we tragically lost him.

To make things worse, the hospital delayed issuing the death report, making us run around for two more days while we were already grieving.

Unless you have influence or strong connections, you might not receive the care and attention you deserve here. For us, it was a heartbreaking and irreparable loss. I would not recommend this hospital to anyone.

"DEADLY NEGLIGENCE AT MEDICA HOSPITALDO NOT TRUST DR. AMLAN MANDAL"

It is with deep grief, anguish, and a heavy heart that I write this review. My father, aged 63 years, was admitted to Medica Superspecialty Hospital, Kolkata on 23rd February 2025, under the care of Dr. Amlan Mandal. What we believed would be a short-term observation for a manageable condition turned into a devastating loss, due to sheer medical negligence, arrogance, and lack of empathy.

My father was generally fit and active for his age. He suddenly fell ill, lost bowel control, and was found to have an old blood clot and a mild reaction to recent medications. Based on this, we rushed him to Medica for emergency admission. After initial tests, the doctors themselves told us that the condition was not as serious as we fearedthe blood clots were old and manageable, and the primary issue was an electrolyte imbalance(sodium-potassium levels). With basic treatment, his condition improved within hourshe was walking, talking, and feeling normal.

Despite his rapid improvement, the medical team insisted on keeping him for just two more days for observation. Our family was inclined to bring him home, but we were convinced to let him stay, thinking it was the safer optiona decision we now deeply regret.

From Day 2 onwards, the situation took a mysterious and alarming turn. The doctors began pointing out new symptoms every dayissues with food consumption, oxygen imbalance, discomfort. They inserted a Ryles tube(nasogastric tube) even though my father had no swallowing issues initially. They placed him on oxygen support, and later diagnosed a lung infection that had never existed before his hospital admission. This infection spiraled out of control, and they utterly failed to detect or manage it properly.

Throughout this time, Dr. Amlan Mandal and his team were dismissive, rude, and extremely difficult to communicate with. Every time we asked for clarification or questioned the declining health of our loved one, we were met with condescending responses like, "Do you understand more than us?". Dr. Mandal carried himself with an air of superiority, completely ignoring the legitimate concerns of family members who were watching a loved one deteriorate before their eyes.

When the Ryles tube was inserted, my father visibly showed discomfort and distressmoving his legs, adjusting his posturesigns which were ignored by the medical staff. And because he was moved to the ICU, we were cut off from monitoring his care closely, unable to intervene or transfer him to another hospital once we realized things were spiraling out of control. We were simply told to wait and trust the processa process that ultimately led to his death.

Whats even more disturbing is what one of the hospital staff told our family driver, who was crying on the day of the passing:

This hospital is nothing but a business. Its a place of death, not care.

That one sentence said everything we had felt but couldnt believethat our trust had been horribly misplaced. My father entered this hospital walking and talking, and within 10 days, he was gonenot because of the original condition, but because of the negligence, mishandling, and egotistical approach of Dr. Amlan Mandal and his team.

This review is not written out of impulseits a warning to families who are considering placing their loved ones under his care. Our biggest mistake was trusting him and this hospital. Please, dont make the same one.

SUMMARY

my old aged mother at 77 yrs was kept for 16 days in ICU & LOST her LIFE due to wrong promises & ignorance by Doctors & ICU team

STORY - unbelievable

with lot hopes & trust on Dr.Vivekananda Gajapati , we admitted my mother , 77 yrs senior old woman on 26.01.2025 who had breathlessness issue.

Dr.Vivekananda told us to go for open heart surgery & not to hear any words of my mother

the first day I told doctor - will keep my mother in ward & incase of breathlessness will need your observation & checkup

but Dr.Vivekananda straight away told we have to admit my mother to ICU only

due to bad experience in ICU earlier, we did not want but because of Dr pressure we admitted to ICU with only left TRUST

my mother was good first day, had good natural night sleep post many days wo any oxygen

2nd night on 27.01.2025 > i just entered ICU accidently at 4am & found my mother struggling with breathlessness fully sweating , in dark, no AC & no doctors or nurses to attend her

I Immediately called doctors & nurses & got nebuliser given & my mother was ok after 30min

insisted ICU staff to take care of my mother, going forward

3rd night - at 10pm - mother started shivering with cold in the stomach while having dinner - all doctors & nurses rushed in , my mother got panic- tried to come out of the bed- shouting please discharge me.

he was forced to bed by nurses & doctors & gave sleeping dose & took my signature for ventilation & next morning on 29.01.2025 - I see my mother on ventilation- mouth shut - cannot express or disclose nothing from heart what she wants to tell

ventilation was supposed to be opened after 48 hrs by anistia Dr.pramod - but Dr.Vivekananda straight away declined & asked not to remove this ventilation till angiogram & surgery on monday 03.02.2025still 3 days to go as the senior surgeon Dr.Suraj was on leave till Sunday

my old aged mother (77yrs) was with only liquid food & was very weak till surgery day & got fever of 109 degrees

but still was taken for surgery in this BAD morher condition by senior surgeon Dr.Sai Suraj

we were told by Dr.Vivekananda also that all organs are working well except heart - will get resolved this heart issue also with this surgery done - gavelot of hopes

handed over my mother to Dr Sai Suraj & just washed his hands & responsibility

Dr.Sai Suraj operated my mother in 6 yrs & told operation successful - we all family were happy & thanked Dr.for this success

2 days gone, , on wed 05.02.2025 , ventilation was replaced with oxygen - but post 4 hrs - my mother got unconscious & was again replaced with ventilator

Dr.Sai Suraj tells next day morning thu 06.01.2025I'm not there again for next 2 days & will return back on Sunday 09.02.2025

we got panic , my mother was this difficult stage & Dr is taking off

Dr Sai suraj gave us confidence that his team will take care of my mother well

the same day night - the ICU doctor Dr.Chandrashekar tells me - your mother is very weak was on ventilation before surgery last week & also aged - so she is not able to breath back

I was shocked with this statement. Mother age is 77 hrs is already known from inception & my mother is weak because of ventation since last 1 week before surgery - was also known to ICU team

THEN WHY MY MOTHER WAS TAKEN FOR SURGERY , when all these were WELL KNOWN before ?

my mother CONTINUED further on same VENTILATION & was told will remove on monday 10.02.2025

my mother was feeling very weak without proper food & with MOUTH SHUT since 28.02 - 08.02.2025

got report on 06.02.2025 > Blood Urea & Infection is high - later controlled in next 2 days on 08.02.2025

Suddenly on 08.02.2025 evening 6pm

the Anistia doctor calls us & tells my family

YOUR MOTHER CONDITION WORSENING with Antibiotics not working & infection getting worsened.

we were SHOCKED with this statement
since 2 days we were told the UREA & Infection is controlling & suddenly this surprise statement
.

We called Dr.Sai Suraj & Dr.Vivekananda- both just telling - our team is trying our best - but nothing happening from team & both Dpctors enjoying their week ends

MY MOTHER HAD CARDIAV ATTACK in next 2 HRS & LOST HER LIFE

WE FAMILY WERE WAITING FOR OUR MOTHERS WELLNESS IN NEXT 2 DAYS & GETTING SHIFTED TO WARD & DISCHARGING - BUT NH - SDM JUST IGNORED & KILLED MY MOTHER ( who refused to get admitted to SDM hospital & get operated due to bad early experience- we took a chance & we failed badly

Many told us not to go with operation at this age of mother but still we TRUSTED Dr.Vivekananda Gajapati & went ahead - but we were WRONG & all others were RIGHT

I learned 4 things today with this

1) DO NOT OPERATE - POST 60 YRS &

2) DO NOT OPERATE with WEAK condition & FEVER

3) NEVER GO ON DR.WORDS -take RIGHT DECISION

4) ALSO TAKE PATIENT OPINION - ITS THEIR LIFE

I am writing to express my profound grief and disappointment with the treatment my son received at Mazundar Shaw Medical Center, specifically under the care of Dr. Sunil Bhat. Unfortunately, my son passed away during his treatment, and I feel compelled to share my experience in the hope that it may prevent others from enduring similar hardship.

My son underwent a stem cell transplant at this hospital, and from the outset, we faced multiple complications, including severe fever, loose motions, and respiratory issues. Despite these complications, the treatment offered was inadequate, and the management of these issues was subpar, with no clear path for resolution.

Additionally, I found the hospital’s practices, including exorbitant medical charges and an overall lack of proper care, to be deeply concerning. The success rate of stem cell transplants, which I was told was only around 20%, is a significant factor to consider, and I wish I had been made more fully aware of the risks and the likelihood of success before proceeding.

During the course of treatment, my son was subjected to high doses of medication and injections, which were not adequately monitored. It seems that the overdose of these medications may have contributed to his condition worsening, leading to his untimely death.

I invested a significant amount of money—over 55 lakhs—hoping to save my child, but in the end, I lost him due to what I believe was both ineffective treatment and lack of proper care.

I strongly urge anyone considering stem cell treatment at Mazundar Shaw Medical Center to think carefully and weigh the risks involved. My family and I were devastated by this experience, and I want to make sure that others are fully informed before making such a critical decision.
Good hospital for kids and neonatal care. Care given by the doctor and staffs are satisfactory. Affordable and recommended for childrens and parents

My wife was shifted for o.t on 26/10/24 at 8am and I was told at 9p.m to vaccant the room by a security'sent by m.o.d.when asked them why is so ? They showed me one paper where those points are written.But my question is m.o.d should discuss such serious matter with patients attendant.My advice is pls.read all the paper before sign it.

At first we came here in this Hospital and we meet with doctor Uday khanolkar. he suggested for an angiogram. the doctor did the angiogram himself. when the angiogram was done, he said the condition of the patient is not so bad, no surgery is needed within 5 years, only take medicines and follow-up. After that he referred to Dr Devi shetty. When we met to Dr Devi Shetty, doctor said that it is emergency to replace aortic valve. Really it was very confusing and it was difficult to take decision either go for surgery or not. We need same decisions from all doctors.

Well! the hospital is neat and clean. service is good. But for treatment it takes more patience for the patients. Bangladesh help desk is very helpful for the new Bangladeshi patients.

Long waiting hours to admit patient in emergency(minimum 2.5hrs to 3.0hrs)
One of the highest room charges for the semiprivate and private room(Semi private room: 8500Rs for each and 3 patient in that room, Private room: 15000Rs)
Long waiting hours to get semiprivate or private room(Approximately 4Hrs)

Total waiting hours to get room is approx 7Hrs(waiting for emergency+ waiting hours to get room), if you will take regular follow up to get room or standing in front of Dr. then only people will get the room in 7Hrs, otherwise it will take more than that.
Cleaning was not up to the mark:
Dustbin was in open condition and small insect were flying above that dustbin. Cockroach problem in pediatric ward.

Only one time cleaning.
No facility available to clean the patient.
If patient was shifted ICU from Semi private or Private room, people has to vacate the room.
Where patient attender will go with the bags and other belongings. No answer for that.
Support staff behavior is very bad.
No support form administrative side. No one will give clear information.
Only one time Dr. will visit but no clear time, they can came any time in a day.
Conclusion: I felt, I am in government hospital but paying money like private hospital.

I recently had the opportunity to visit Dharamshila Cancer Hospital, and I must say the experience was both comforting and reassuring. The hospital is well-equipped with advanced technology, and the medical team is highly professional and experienced in their respective fields.

From the moment you step into the hospital, you are greeted with warmth and compassion. The staff is incredibly supportive, making sure that both patients and their families feel at ease during what can be a very challenging time. The doctors take the time to explain every aspect of the treatment plan, addressing any concerns or doubts with patience.

One aspect that particularly stood out was the hospital's emphasis on holistic care. They don't just focus on treating the disease but also on the overall well-being of the patient. The availability of counseling services, nutritional support, and various wellness programs is a testament to their commitment to comprehensive care.

The hospital's infrastructure is modern and clean, ensuring a comfortable environment for recovery. The nursing staff is attentive, and the administration is efficient in handling appointments, billing, and other formalities.

Overall, Dharamshila Cancer Hospital provides a beacon of hope for those battling cancer. Their dedication to providing quality care, combined with their compassionate approach, makes it a place where you feel confident in the treatment you or your loved ones are receiving.

Recently visited(on 01-July-2024) this hospital for vascular surgery. Done too many tests(Blood test Urine Test ECG Echo Xray Scanning for legs) which are overpriced. Totally 16000 rupees charged for all tests. additionally charged 4900 rupees for stockings. Where as other hospitals are giving it for free after the surgery is done. Each doctor consultation is 1100 rupees. For checking all the reports and BP they charged 1100rupees. For surgery they do have packages. For me the final and estimated cost was 230000 rupees. Since the cost of the surgery is more I haven't admitted at Narayana. They do have NH care App for the report results and doctor appointment bookings. Since I didn't go for surgery at Narayana Health they have removed all my report results from the app. I wasn't able to view any of my test reports from that app. And they have never given any access to my test reports. Called customer care number and requested for the reports. They asked me to visit the hospital for any help required.

Admitted to different hospital and the same surgery was done with the half of the price what Narayana Health was charging. Stockings were provided at free of cost. Transportation was provided. Picked up at my home location and dropped me back after surgery at free of cost. Appointments and timings are just for show off. You won't get your doctor appointment at the specified time. One full day is required to meet doctor and to come out of the hospital. Unnecessary tests will be done for a high price.

Narayana Health hospital is money minded.

Doctors gives time only for couple of mins, quickly comes to a conclusion and prescribe next steps. Tests like MRI, USG, endoscopy are completed in few mins. Don’t recommend this hospital especially if you really care about yourself or dear ones.

I recently had the opportunity to experience the comprehensive care provided by RN Tagore Hospital for Robotic Assisted Lap Hysterectomy and bilateral Salpingectomy, and I am pleased to share my exceptional experience from admission to discharge.

We were recommended by Dr Asish Kumar Ghosh.From the moment we entered the RN hospital, the admission process was seamless and efficient. The admission personnel were professional, courteous, and extremely helpful. They guided me through the necessary paperwork swiftly, ensuring I understood each step of the process. Their empathetic approach made a potentially stressful situation feel manageable and straightforward.

Once admitted, the care provided by the nursing staff was nothing short of exemplary. The nurses were not only highly skilled but also incredibly compassionate. They attended to my needs promptly and with great care, always making sure I was comfortable and well-informed about my treatment. Their dedication to patient care was evident in every interaction, and they went above and beyond to ensure my well-being.

The hospital staff, including the doctors and support personnel, demonstrated a high level of professionalism and expertise. The doctors were thorough in their explanations, providing detailed information about my condition and the upcoming operation. They patiently answered all my questions, which greatly alleviated my concerns and built my confidence in the treatment plan.

The RN Tagore TPA (Third Party Administrator) Mr Pradip Kumar Saha and team at RN Tagore Hospital deserve special mention for their efficiency and supportive attitude. Navigating insurance processes can be daunting, but the TPA team handled everything with remarkable efficiency. They communicated clearly about the coverage, facilitated smooth transactions, and ensured that all necessary approvals were obtained promptly. Their assistance was invaluable in making the financial aspects of my hospital stay as hassle-free as possible.

The surgical team with Dr Asish Kumar Ghosh and Dr Satyadip Mukherjee displayed an impressive level of competence and coordination. My wife's operation was conducted with precision and care, and I felt reassured by their confident and professional demeanor. Post-surgery, the nursing staff continued to provide excellent care, ensuring a smooth recovery process.

Finally, the discharge procedure was handled with the same level of professionalism and care that characterized my entire stay by Mr Arpan ke Bera and Ms Sukanya Muhuri and team. The discharge personnel ensured that all formalities were completed swiftly and that I received clear instructions for post-discharge care. They also arranged a follow-up schedule and provided contact information for any post-discharge queries, ensuring a smooth transition from hospital to home.

In summary, RN Tagore Hospital exceeded my expectations at every stage. The combination of skilled medical care, compassionate nursing, efficient administrative support, and comprehensive discharge planning made my experience outstanding. I highly recommend RN Tagore Hospital to anyone seeking high-quality medical care.

My aunt got her CSF procedure done at the HSR Narayana based on advice from Dr Anush Rangarajan who works out of the main Narayana Hrudayalaya. 3 tubes of spinal fluid was collected and we were told to expect the result the next day by afternoon. We waited 2 days before approaching the HSR hospital for results. Imagine our horror and surprise when the laboratory which was on the 4th floor of the same hospital told us that they have not received the spinal fluid for testing. We spoke to the Manager on Duty and he tried to trace the whereabouts of the fluid and then acknowledged that he did not know where it is. He told us that they had a spare fluid tube which was kept in freezer which they will send for testing.

My questions

a) How do we know it is my aunt's spinal fluid they are now sending for testing?

b) How do we know the fluid taken 2 days ago and now sent for testing will give correct results?(Integrity of the result)

c) Dr Anush had asked us to get the test done asap. But results are delayed due to Hospital's negligence

The hospital has not bothered to even call to apologize for the negligence and have chosen to remain silent.

I had booked a slot with paediatric Dr. Anil Sapare on February 5th 2024 for my infant daughter at 6:30PM through NH Care mobile application well in advance almost 4 hours prior to the scheduled appointment time, and also had made payment of Rs 1200 (100 for registration + 1100 for consultation). However on visiting the hospital at around 6 PM we were informed that the doctor cannot attend us as he has to attend some emergency even though he was at his room. They said there is some technical glitch in the app because of which we got the slot, and refused to attend my baby. They didn't even have the ethics to refund the whole amount. After requesting them they have now just initiated refund of rs1100 (rs100 is non refundable they said). Still awaiting the refund to my account. They have wasted our precious time causing more discomfort to us. Planning to file case in consumer court regarding this.

For an example, the OT timing has increased all of a sudden, after taking my father to the OT, the anaesthetist came with a form saying that the patient needs to be shifted to the ICU after the surgery and we have to sign the consent form for that. I wonder why this was not mentioned to us and why at the very last minute when the patient party has no option remain. Even if they used only one medicine, the bill was included the whole strip of that medicine. This happened in every single case.

The worst experience ever and will not recommend anyone.

My Mother diagnosed with Stage 4 Non Hodgkin's Lymphoma.

Doctor explained the situation to us exactly and clearly.

He knows his job very well. He is very calm and composed doctor.

Resolves all our queries.

After taking his treatment my mother is into complete remission and I hope she will win her war against cancer.

I visited Narayana Multispeciality Hospital in Harikere to get endoscopy done under guidance of Dr Shivakumar. It was well maintained hygienic, the staff, nurse were calm and composed, they made sure I don't feel any pain during endoscopy. I had been suffering from severe vertigo's emerging due to gastric problems, after finding out the root cause which is H pylori, they gave me medicines which cured my disease within a month. I cant thank Dr shivakumar much enough because he was a god who helped me cure my disease. I would recommend people to visit narayana hospital as they have excellent modern techniques for diagnosing diseases.

Not sure which name suits this hospital best. Highly understaffed. Staff attitude is worst because they are over worked and no motivation. Will make you to solve the puzzle how to get admitted. If you have insurance go there. Else you will need hospitalisation after dealing with the crooks there. The agency asked them to write the policy number clearly and they have no way of knowing that there is a reply. We have to go and tell them to check their inbox and they are supremely skilled to send you away with the query making it look complex so that you are put their sight. Terrible dept. Overall a pathetic hospital which cannot qualify for treatment. Stay away.

Hello Everyone

I have been admitted to Narayana Multispeciality Hospital in Kolkata in 2014as I am suffering from Colastic Jaundice (Fluctuating Bilorobin)as well as my both the legs are vibrating and I had itching problems throughout my whole body.Ihad been admitted at HDU for treatment. I am under the Doctor named Mr. S Pal who is a specialist in this section. Also the nurses behaviours are caring. One more important thing is that behind each bed there is a switch, if any patient wants to call the nurses (both male and female)he/she can press the bell anytime.

When I had been admitted my Bilirobin showing as 20 but staying under treatment for 10 days my Bilirobin falls to 4 respectively.

I was given Ice bump in my legs for 9 days and from the 10th day I feel no problem in my leg. For itching problems an ointment was provided to me. I had gone through MRI as well as blood tests too. The hospital is clean enough.

The infrastructure of the hospital is quite satisfactory but the fees of the hospital is expensive.

After 10 days I was released from the hospital and advised by the doctor to take rests.

After 1 month also my Bilorobin was at 4. Thereafter I moved to CMC, Vellore for further treatment and got 100 percent cured from there.

I may suggest that you too can admit yourself or your nearest ones at NarayanaMultispeciality Hospitals for better treatment.

Thanks For Reading.
